section.section: The business of a cooperative shall be managed by a board of directors.
Each cooperative shall have at least five directors.

text.section: Each director shall be a member of the cooperative or of a member cooperative.

section.section: The bylaws may provide for the removal of directors from office and for the election of their successors.

text.section: If a husband and wife hold a joint membership in a cooperative, either one, but not both, may be elected a director.
A majority of the board of directors is a quorum.

section.section: A director may not receive a salary for serving as a director.
Except in emergencies, a director may not be employed by the cooperative in any capacity involving compensation without the approval of the members.
The bylaws may authorize a fixed fee and expenses to be paid to each director for attending a meeting of the board of directors.

text.section: The board of directors may exercise all of the powers of a cooperative not conferred on the members by this subtitle or the cooperative's articles of incorporation or bylaws.
